text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with peanut butter and pepper jelly
wings that's right it's peanut butter
jelly time remember where you were the
first time you saw that video anyway
it's also playoff football time and
we're always looking for new chicken
wing recipes to blow our friends away
and hopefully this one does so we're
gonna start with that's right peanut
butter and jelly I'm just using a
regular smooth style peanut butter and
then equal amounts of a jalapeno jelly
and this is right from the grocery store
alright so this is not hard to find you
can always check specialty food shops
online of course ok to that we're gonna
add some soy sauce some seasoned rice
vinegar some Asian fish sauce a little
bit of toasted sesame oil and of course
some hot sauce I'm using sriracha
depending on how hot your pepper jelly
is you may have to adjust that I'm also
gonna add some crushed garlic and some
red chili flakes alright and that's
pretty much it so I'm gonna give that a
good mix a good stir peanut butter does
not usually want to mix into things very
well you'll actually see in some peanut
sauce recipes will have you heat the
liquids to make it easier to mix the
peanut butter in so you can do that if
you want but I don't it just takes a
minute of whisking and you're good and
that we're just gonna reserve until
needed alright next up is the chicken
wings and I'm going to show you a
technique that I've been experimenting
with to simulate the texture of a fried
chicken wing in the oven so we're gonna
take some dry chicken wings they have to
be thawed thoroughly and very dry to
that I'm gonna add some grapeseed oil or
any kind of vegetable oil all right just
a little bit some black pepper some
cayenne pepper and some salt and then
hold on to your seats some instant
mashed potato buds that's right instant
mashed potato powder you may remember
that as a secret ingredient in such
videos as our famous crispy onion rings
so we're gonna sprinkle a little bit of
that in I'm gonna take a spatula and I'm
gonna toss those chicken wings and
what's gonna happen is they're gonna get
coated with that oil and the seasonings
and that fine fine dusting of potato
starch and when these roast in that hot
then there's gonna be a little bit of a
coating that forms on the chicken that
will simulate hopefully something closer
to something out of a deep fryer all
right so once those are coated we're
gonna transfer on to our Silpat on a
half sheet pan space them evenly and
those are gonna go in a hot oven 425 for
50 minutes
so the first time it's a half hour so 30
minutes we're gonna give them a flip and
they're not going to be doing too much
at that point but that potato starch
coating will be starting to form those
are gonna go back in for 20 minutes and
at that point you're gonna have a decent
coating you're gonna be surprised I mean
nothing's gonna be like out of a deep
fryer but it really does give it a nice
crusty texture which really holds on to
the sauce which is the next step
we're gonna transfer these into our bowl
of sauce give them a good tossing around
and when they're well coated we're gonna
put them back on the baking sheet by the
way if there was any excess grease on
that sheet just blot it off with paper
towel so we're gonna put the wings back
on those go in for five more minutes
that's all it's gonna take and five
minutes later you're gonna be looking at
these gorgeous gorgeous peanut butter
and pepper jelly chicken wings if you've
ever been sitting around thinking sure
there's peanut butter and jelly sandwich
is good but I wish it had bones in it
and tasted more like chicken this is the
answer to your prayers I'm gonna present
mine with a little bit of green onion on
top there's so many ways you could
garnish this of course all right you can
put things like cilantro in here ginger
sesame seeds lots of different ways to
go and that's part of the fun of a
recipe like this I want you to take it
and run with it run with it the way
Brandon Jacobs is gonna run over Packer
linebackers and of course I need to try
one just really really like this chicken
wing sweet spicy a little bit salty
those nuts give the chicken and even
meteor flavor just a really really
delicious chicken wing so you can't just
put out the same old buffalo chicken
wings every year give these a try if
you're looking for something new and
exciting so head over to food wishes
comm for all the ingredient amounts as
usual
and as always enjoy
[Music]
